Apart from gouty attacks, gout can give rise to the following manifestations:

- after several years, gout can affect the upper limbs and even the spine, hip and shoulder.

- oligoarthritis or gouty polyarthritis may occur.

question.title: What can happen to a person with gout after several years?
question.description: A person with gout may experience the following manifestations

option_a.title: Only joint pain and swelling in the hands and feet
option_a.description: A common symptom of gout, but not a long-term effect

option_b.title: Oligoarthritis or gouty polyarthritis may occur
option_b.description: A known complication of long-standing gout

option_c.title: Cardiovascular disease and diabetes
option_c.description: Common comorbidities with gout, but not a direct effect

option_d.title: Neurological disorders such as Parkinson's disease
option_d.description: Not a known complication of gout
